title: Islamabad Police to take legal action against those obstructing Imran Khan’s arrest
content:
ISLAMABAD, Mar 14 (APP): The Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) Police on Tuesday said legal action would be taken against those who were obstructing the implementation of the court orders regarding the arrest of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf Chairman Imran Khan in the Toshakhana case.
An ICT Police team had been in Lahore since yesterday to comply with the court orders and the Punjab Police were extending their support to it, an Islamabad Police spokesperson said.
ترجمان اسلام آباد کیپیٹل پولیس
ڈی آئی جی آپریشنز اور ایس پی بالکل خیریت سے ہیں۔
پنجاب پولیس اسلام آباد کیپیٹل پولیس کی مکمل معاونت کررہی ہے۔
عدالتی احکامات میں رکاوٹ بننے والوں کے خلاف قانونی کارروائی کی جائے گی۔#Islamabad  #Police
— Islamabad Police (@ICT_Police) March 14, 2023
He said the Deputy Inspector General (Operations) and the Senior Superintendent of Police were safe.
